overview: Find out how to get a private hire or taxi driver licence to work in London
title: Driving licences for private hire or taxis in London

table.body:
To become a taxi or private hire driver in London you’ll need to apply to Transport for London (TfL) for the correct driving licence.
 
There are 2 types of driving licenses for taxi drivers:

- the all London licence (known as a 'green badge') which allows you to work throughout London
- the suburban licence (known as a 'yellow badge') which restricts you to working in the suburban areas of London

Private hire drivers will need to apply for a [private hire driving licence](/driving-licences-private-hire-taxis-london/apply-for-a-private-hire-vehicle-drivers-licence "Apply for a private hire vehicle drivers licence").

Before applying for your driver’s licence, you'll need to apply for an [enhanced Criminal Records Bureau (CRB)](http://www.tfl.gov.uk/businessandpartners/taxisandprivatehire/21510.aspx"Criminal Records Bureau"){:rel="external"} check.

*[DVLA]: Driver and Vehicle Licensing Agency
*[CRB]: Criminal Records Bureau 
*[PHV]: Private hire vehicle
*[TfL]: Transport for London
*[GB]: Great Britain

*[EU]: European Union
*[UK]: United Kingdom
*[EEA]: European Economic Area
table.title: Overview

table.body:
To apply for a taxi licence in London you must be:

- at least 21 years old
- a UK or European Union (EU) citizen, or have the right the stay and work in the UK
- the holder of a full Great Britain (GB), Northern Ireland (NI) or European Economic Area (EEA) driving licence

You’ll also need to:

- have a [Criminal Records Bureau (CRB) check](http://www.tfl.gov.uk/businessandpartners/taxisandprivatehire/21510.aspx "Criminal Records Bureau"){:rel="external"} which costs £36
- pass [‘the knowledge’ test](http://www.tfl.gov.uk/businessandpartners/taxisandprivatehire/1412.aspx "the knowledge test"){:rel="external"}
- pass the Driving standards Agency (DSA) [taxi driving assessment](/dsa-taxi-driving-test "DSA taxi driving assessment")
- have a medical examination with your GP

You can get a taxi [driver application form](http://www.tfl.gov.uk/businessandpartners/taxisandprivatehire/1366.aspx#page-link-applying-for-a-licence "Driver application form"){:rel="external"} from Transport for London (TfL).

*[DVLA]: Driver and Vehicle Licensing Agency
*[CRB]: Criminal Records Bureau 
*[PHV]: Private hire vehicle
*[TfL]: Transport for London
*[GB]: Great Britain
*[NI]: Northern Ireland
*[EU]: European Union
*[UK]: United Kingdom
*[EEA]: European Economic Area 
*[DSA]: Driving standards Agency
table.title: Apply for a taxi licence

table.body:
Transport for London (TfL) will send you a renewal form before your current driving licence expires. You can also get one from the TfL office or use the [Post Office check and send service.](http://www.tfl.gov.uk/businessandpartners/taxisandprivatehire/10900.aspx "Post Office check and send service"){:rel="external"}

%If you don’t renew your licence before it expires you won’t be able to work as a licensed taxi driver.%


##Criminal Records Bureau (CRB) check##

Before returning your renewal you'll need to apply for an [enhanced CRB check.](http://www.tfl.gov.uk/businessandpartners/taxisandprivatehire/21510.aspx "Enhanced "Enhanced CRB check"){:rel="external"}

##What you need to send with your renewal##

When returning your renewal form to TfL you’ll need to include:

- 2 passport-sized photographs
- your current DVLA licence (for photocard licences the paper copy must also be attached)
- your current taxi driver's licence (the copy and original)
- payment of £249
- your CRB reference number

##Postal address##

Please return your renewal form, supporting documents and payment to TfL. 

$A
Driver Renewals 
TfL - London Taxi and Private Hire 
Palestra, 4th floor (Green zone)
197 Blackfriars Road
London 
SE1 8NJ
$A

*[CRB]: Criminal Records Bureau

table.title: Renewing your taxi driver licence

table.body:
If you want to work as a private hire vehicle (PHV) driver in London, you'll need to hold a driver licence issued by Transport for London (TfL).

##Applying for your PHV drivers licence##

To apply for your PHV drivers licence you'll need to:

- be at least 21 years of age 
- have held a full Great Britain (GB), Northern Ireland (NI) or European Economic Area  (EEA) driving licence for at least 3 years
- have the right to live and work in the UK
- have an [enhanced Criminal Records Bureau (CRB) check](http://www.tfl.gov.uk/businessandpartners/taxisandprivatehire/21510.aspx "Enhanced CRB check"){:rel="external"} which will cost £36 
- have a medical examination with your GP
- sit a [topographical (route finding) skills test](http://www.tfl.gov.uk/businessandpartners/taxisandprivatehire/1350.aspx#skills "Topographical skills test"){:rel="external"} 

You can apply for your [PHV driver licence](http://www.tfl.gov.uk/businessandpartners/taxisandprivatehire/1346.aspx "PHV driver licence"){:rel="external"} from TfL. 

The current fee is £298 for 3 years.

*[DVLA]: Driver and Vehicle Licensing Agency
*[CRB]: Criminal Records Bureau 
*[PHV]: Private hire vehicle
*[TfL]: Transport for London
*[GB]: Great Britain
*[NI]: Northern Ireland
*[EU]: European Union
*[UK]: United Kingdom
*[EEA]: European Economic Area
table.title: Apply for a private hire vehicle drivers licence

table.body:
Transport for London (TfL) will send you a renewal form before your current driving licence expires. You can also get one from the TfL office or use the [Post Office check and send service](http://www.tfl.gov.uk/businessandpartners/taxisandprivatehire/10899.aspx "Post Office check and send service"){:rel="external"}.

^You need to send your renewal form to TfL 6 weeks before your licence expires^

%If you don’t renew your licence before it expires you won’t be able to work as a private hire driver%

##What you need to send with your renewal##

When returning your renewal form to TfL you’ll need to include:

- 1 recent, colour passport-sized photograph
- clear photocopies of both sides of your current DVLA licence (for photocard licences the paper copy must also be attached)
- a completed [enhanced Criminal Records Bureau (CRB) check](http://www.tfl.gov.uk/businessandpartners/taxisandprivatehire/1348.aspx#page-link-criminal-records-bureau-disclosure "Enhanced CRB check"){:rel="external"}
- a completed [medical form](http://www.tfl.gov.uk/businessandpartners/taxisandprivatehire/1348.aspx#page-link-medicals "Medical form"){:rel="external"}, if required
- payment of £306 (to cover the licence application, CRB Disclosure application and grant of licence fees)

##Postal address##

Please return your renewal form, supporting documents and payment to TfL. 

$A
Private Hire Driver Renewals 
TfL - London Taxi and Private Hire 
Palestra, 4th floor (Green zone)
197 Blackfriars Road
London
